intro: Callaria, commonly known as white sweet clover, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees. Callaria is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. It is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing abilities, making it useful in soil enrichment.
